intro: Dilkea cuneata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed thornapple, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and showy, violet-blue flowers. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
